info.title: SeaNotify API Server
info.description:
- [Overview](#section/Overview)
- [Getting Started](#Getting-Started)
- [Authorization](#section/Authorization)
- [Response Codes](#section/Response-Codes)
- [Error Message Format](#section/Error-Message-Format)

## Overview

Welcome to the SeaNotify API integration guide. SeaNotify is a webhook-based event subscription system designed to help your system receive real-time notifications when specific events occur in Seasalt products. These events are grouped by **workspace**, and a valid **API key** is required for authentication.

This document walks you through how to register, manage, and receive webhook events via API. SeaNotify supports multiple event types and scheduling modes (e.g., immediate, delayed, batched), making it suitable for diverse integration needs.

If you encounter any issues or have questions, contact us at [seanotify@seasalt.ai](mailto:seanotify@seasalt.ai).

## Getting Started

Before using SeaNotify, complete the following steps:

1. **Prepare Your Workspace**:

   - You need an active SeaChat or Seasalt workspace.
   - Locate your workspace ID from the workspace settings or dashboard URL.

2. **Generate an API Key**:

   - Login to [Seasalt Portal](https://portal.seasalt.ai)
   - Go to the Settings → API Key tab.
   - Click Add New Key and create a new API key.
   - Enable API access and copy your key. This key will be required for all API requests and please protect it with extreme caution.

3. **Design Your Webhook Receiver**:

   - Make sure your webhook URL is publicly accessible and supports HTTPS.
   - Your endpoint should be able to handle POST requests with JSON payloads.

4. **Register a Subscription**:

   - Use the `POST /api/v1/workspaces/{workspace_id}/subscription` endpoint to create a new webhook subscription.
   - You can specify the event type(s). See the corresponding section for request and response format.

5. **Test Delivery**:
   - Use the `POST /api/v1/workspaces/{workspace_id}/test` endpoint to trigger a sample event. See the corresponding section for request and response format.

## Authorization

All API requests must include a valid SeaNotify Workspace API key using the custom X-API-Key header.

```bash
X-API-Key: <your_workspace_api_key>
```

This key uniquely identifies your workspace and must be included in every request to access protected endpoints. You can find or regenerate this key in the Workspace Settings → API Key tab.

## Example Curl

```bash
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://portal.seasalt.ai/notify/api/v1/workspaces/{workspace_id}/test' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'X-API-Key: <your_workspace_api_key>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "event_type": "message.new",
    "webhook_url": "https://example.com/webhook",
    "event_type": "message.new"
  }'
```

## Response Codes

For success responses, SeaNotify only use two codes to indicate success:

1. `200`, indicating that the operation was successful, with a response body attached.
2. `204`, indicating that the operation was successful but no response body.

## Error Message Format

When the response code is a value above 400, the request body will be a fixed format content with the following structure

| Name       | Type   | Description                                                                                                           | Example |
| ---------- | ------ | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- |
| detail     | string | Description of the error that occurred                                                                                |         |
| code       | number | The error code can be used to confirm the error type                                                                  |         |
| parameters | object | The error message may contain parameter information. If there is no parameter information, it will be an empty object |         |

Example of the request body in case of error

```json
{
  "detail": "The token: testtoken decoding failed.",
  "code": 40007,
  "parameters": {
    "token": "testtoken"
  }
}
```

```json
{
  "detail": "The account: related to the passed in workspace API key does not have the permission to perform this action",
  "code": 40001,
  "parameters": {
    "account_id": "related to the passed in workspace API key"
  }
}
```

get.summary: Retrieves all notification subscriptions for a specific workspace

parameters.description: Order items by field and direction, format: <field>:<direction> (e.g., created_at:desc)

parameters.name: type

post.description: Create a new subscription with events.

delete.description: Delete a subscription given a subscription id.

patch.description: Update a subscription's webhook URL and/or event types.

get.description:
Get all available event types.

Args:
    db (AsyncSession): The database session

Returns:
    List[EventTypeResponse]: List of all available event types

Raises:
    HTTPException: If there's a database error

content.text: Hello, how can I assist you today?

status.description: The status of the webhook test, indicating success or error.
